intro: Porpax albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered porpax, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Porpax albiflora is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soil. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small insects.
